agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering assistance in finding resources that provide medications at little to no cost.
service_name: THE MARY POTTER MEDICATION RESOURCE CENTER
service_description: Offers assistance in finding resources that provide medications at little to no cost.
site_details: Referral from primary care provider
site_eligibility: Low income -- No prescription insurance coverage -- Under-insured - Have a primary care provider

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides a comprehensive special education program for students with disabilities in Dubois, Perry, Pike, or Spencer County. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 3-21 years-old -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.

site_schedule.name: Lead Poisoning Screening
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Screening: By appointment only

site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Age 6 months and older
Varies by service; serves Dubois County

Living in Dubois County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Living within the Dubois County
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Varies by service; call for details.

Living in Dubois County -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Living in Dubois County -- Age 19 or older
Varies by service

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Dubois County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups. Application process is open all year. Applications can be picked up at the ReStore location, 4232 South 170 East, Huntington.
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
site_details: Call or visit website to learn about application process and requirements. -- Housing applications can be picked up at the ReStore location, 4232 South 170 East, Huntington.

site_schedule.name: Subsidized Home Acquisition
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; depends on current construction project

site_schedule.name: Construction/Home Maintenance Volunteer Opportunities
site_schedule.schedule: Varies; depends on current construction project

site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Below 60% of the combined median household income based (see website for current income guidelines) -- Able to pay approximately $450 a month with a zero-percent annual percentage rate mortgage -- Have no judgement or collections, or ability to resolve judgements or collections -- Have not had a bankruptcy, or the filing was discharged more than two years ago -- Have been employed two years in the same field and have had no more than one job change in the past 24 months

Living in Dubois County -- Below 60% of the combined median household income for Dubois County -- Own and live in home in need of repair -- Have homeowner's insurance coverage -- Be up to date on mortgage and property tax payments -- Agree to partner with HFH in all aspects of the repair project

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY - DUBOIS COUNTY - RESTORE
service_description: Sells donated building supplies, used appliances, and other home items to the public at a discount. Donations accepted during store hours or by arrangement. Pickup is available for large-item donations. Pick-up is available within set boundaries.
site_details: To purchase goods: Walk in. -- To donate goods: Drop off items during business hours. -- To request pick-up of large items: Call to make an appointment (pick-ups limited to a 20 mile radius of Jasper).
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Dubois County. Offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of crimes in Dubois County
Open

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Dubois County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides a food pantry to those in need.

site_eligibility: Living in Dubois County -- Limit two visits per month

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Dubois County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Dubois County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Dubois County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Dubois County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Ferdinand in Dubois County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Dubois County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.

Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Dubois County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for their respective county, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8am

site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8am

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Dubois County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Dubois County Dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Dubois County)

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Dubois County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Dubois County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Dubois County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Huntingburg in Dubois County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the city of Huntingburg in Dubois County.. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.

Open

site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Dubois County.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4pm; Wed 8am-6pm

Offenders assigned to probation by the Dubois County Courts

To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Dubois County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Dubois County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Dubois County
Dubois County juveniles age 17 and under

agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging, providing services to seniors and persons with disabilities in Daviess, Dubois, Greene, Knox, Martin, and Pike County.
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunches and fellowship for area seniors. Diabetic menu available. Reservations required 24 hours in advance. Small donation requested.
site_details: Call the senior center at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Persons age 60 and older or persons with disabilities and their spouses or caregivers

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING DIRECT HOME LOANS - JASPER AREA OFFICE
service_description: Provides loans to rural homeowners with low to very-low-income to purchase, repair or improve their homes, or to remove health and safety hazards. Qualified repairs may include new roof, siding, or windows, new septic system or furnace/AC, or new kitchen cabinets. Interest rate is contingent on applicant's income.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in  Clay, Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Gibson, Greene, Harrison, Knox, Martin, Monroe, Orange, Owen, Perry, Pike, Posey, Spencer, Sullivan, Vanderburgh, Vigo, Warrick, or Washington County-- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

Living in eligible rural area in Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Gibson, Greene, Harrison, Knox, Martin, Monroe, Orange, Perry, Pike, Posey, Spencer, Sullivan, Vanderburgh, Warrick, or Washington County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service;  this district office serves Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Martin, Orange, Perry, and Spencer County.

agency_desc: An agency that offers services to children and families including prevention services through the Community Partners for Child Safety program.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 17
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- Contact will be made by a case manager within 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_name: MEMORIAL HOSPITAL AND HEALTH CARE CENTER
agency_desc: Memorial Hospital and Health Care Center offers complete 24-hour medical care.
service_description: Provides education, referral, and support services to those trying to conceive, pregnant women, and new parents. Case management services with home visits are also offered.
site_details: Call, text, or email for information or to schedule an intake.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Martin, Daviess, or Greene County -- Preparing for pregnancy, currently pregnant, or have an infant less than 18 months old -- Partners connected to the enrolled woman can join.
Live in Dubois, Daviess, Martin, or Greene County

agency_name: MEMORIAL HOSPITAL AND HEALTH CARE CENTER
agency_desc: Memorial Hospital and Health Care Center offers complete 24-hour medical care.
site_name: MEMORIAL HOSPITAL AND HEALTH CARE CENTER
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing comprehensive behavioral health, addiction, and related services.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children by appointment and on a walk-in basis. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to a schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units to eligible families, seniors, and persons with disabilities. Applications to be placed on the wait list are currently being accepted.
site_details: Walk in -OR- apply online at www.huntingburghousing.org.
site_eligibility: Low income -- Priority given to low income persons age 62 or older or with disabilities -- US citizens and eligible immigrants

agency_desc: A recreational facility for residents ages 55 and older.
service_description: Provides a senior day center with activities such as card tournaments and BINGO.
site_details: Walk in. -- Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Citizens of Huntingburg, ages 55 and older.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Jasper in Dubois County.
service_description: Provides a drop-in senior day center with activities and exercise facilities for older adults.
site_details: Walk in or call or visit website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Dubois County residents age 55 and older
Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Jasper in Dubois County.
service_description: Provides electric, water, natural gas and waste water utility services for the city of Jasper in Dubois County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Jasper in Dubois County
Varies by service; services limited to properties within Jasper city limits

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Jasper in Dubois County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, residential recycling, trash/garbage pick up, yard waste recycling, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Jasper in Dubois County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the City of Jasper in Dubois County

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: "TRI-CAP empowers people in our communities to accept responsibility for achieving personal and economic well-being by providing health, housing, and educational services."
service_description: Provides up to $100 in financial assistance, when available, to assist with utility and rent payments. Clients also receive one-on-one budgeting assistance as well as referrals to other community organizations. Participants are asked to return to TRI-CAP on a quarterly basis, for a period of one year, to continue family development.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- Willing to return to TRI-CAP on a quarterly basis, for a period of one year, to continue family development.
Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- At or below 200% Federal Poverty Income Guidelines

Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- Ages 3-5 years -- Children who are: in low-income households, in foster care, homeless, and/or from families receiving public assistance (TANF or SSI) -- other special   circumstances (such as disabilities) may be considered.
Open

Living in Clark, Crawford, Daviess, Dubois, Floyd, Gibson, Greene, Harrison, Jackson, Knox, Lawrence, Martin, Monroe, Orange, Perry, Pike, Posey, Scott, Spencer, Vanderburgh, or Warrick County -- Additional requirements vary by program; call for information

Living in Dubois, Pike, or Warrick County -- Living in the home (either as an owner or a renter) -- Household income up to 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Have or willing to apply for energy assistance program (EAP)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides charitable outreach, including a thrift store and food pantry.
service_description: Sells donated gently used clothing, small appliances, and other household items at discounted prices. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: Thrift Shops
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, and Wed 10am-4pm; Thurs 10am-7:30pm; Fri 10am-4:30pm; Sat 10am-3pm

site_eligibility: Open
Living in Birdseye, Holland, Huntingburg, or St. Henry -- Limit one visit every two weeks

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides an assistance program for victims of domestic, sexual, and teen dating violence, stalking, and human trafficking. A batterers' intervention program for men and women is also available.
service_name: DOMESTIC, SEXUAL, AND TEEN DATING VIOLENCE SERVICES
service_description: Provides confidential victim assistance and crisis response to male and female victims of domestic, sexual, or teen dating violence. Services include safety planning, court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. Transportation to regional domestic violence shelters and other safe housing options may also be offered. Healthy relationship skills and non-violent family education, prevention, and support are also provided.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information, or to schedule an appointment.
